story.kicker_image_caption: National Institute of Technology Admissions 2016: Apply before June 24
story.storykicker: All the candidates can now apply for various Master's degree programmes at the National Institute of Technology, Durgapur. The last date to apply is June 24.
story.storybody:
The National Institute of Technology, Durgapur has released an official notification inviting all the interested, eligible candidates to take admissions in the Master of Technology (M.Tech) and Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D) programme for the commencing academic session.

The last date to apply is June 24.

Eligibility criteria:

Educational qualification:

M.Tech Programme: All the candidates interested in taking admission in this programme need to have a graduate degree in a relevant discipline with 6.5 Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) on a 10-point scale.

Ph.D Programme:

All the applicants interested in pursuing this programme need to have a Bachelor and Master's degree in Technology/Engineering/Architecture/Pharmacy or equivalent in relevant discipline from a recognised technical institute or university/government open university.

Those who are planning to take an admission in the Bachelor's degree programme should have 7.5 CGPA or 70 per cent in aggregate of marks from a recognised technical institute or university/government open university.

Selection procedure:

A screening of applications will be conducted only for the short-listed candidates, who will be called for an admission test and/or interview.

The final selection will be done on the basis of marks obtained.

Application fee:

All the candidates for the M.Tech programme need to pay Rs 1000 as application fee. However, candidates taking admission in the PhD programme need to pay Rs 1500.

How to apply:

  • All the candidates need to apply online on the website, www.nitdgp.ac.in
  • Click on the relevant link
  • Fill in all the details in the prescribed format only
  • Click on to submit
  • Take a printout of the same for future reference.

Important dates:

  • The last date for the submission of a completed application is June 24
  • The last date of receiving a printed version of an application form is June 30
  • For M.Tech programme, the written test and viva-voce will be conducted from July 11 to 13
  • For Ph.D  programme, the written test and viva voce will be held from July 14 to July 15.


Read: Intel competition in US awards six Indian students

For exam related news click here.
